instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 video issue
threads.message:
I've got this 820-3115 that doesn't post video on internal display. video works great threw the thunderbolt port. i can see that the back light is very dim and no picture. the machine did have very minor liquid damage  around c3888 and r3880. 

ppvout_sw_lcdbklt-- 27v
L9080 pin1 and 2 are 1.4v
pp3v3_lcdvdd_sw is 3.32v
pp3v3_s0 3.32v

i have changed the lcd connector as i had the pins smash and touching each other. 
not sure what I'm missing any ideas would be great.

threads.title: 820-3115 video issue
threads.message: Is the screen white or black?

threads.title: 820-3115 video issue
threads.message:
27V is sufficient for normal backlight.
You probably have problem with LCD connector, video cable or display itslef...
However, check return resistors.
NVRAM reset done?

threads.title: 820-3115 video issue
threads.message: screen is black. have already changed connector, lcd cable and screen already swapped from known work machine. ill check resistors though. smc was reset and pram.

threads.title: 820-3115 video issue
threads.message: Measure all LVDS lines on diode mode

threads.title: 820-3115 video issue
threads.message: pin 12 pin15 pin 17 seem like problem with u1800 :(
